security: Revealing that Subject served in the 441st CIC Detachment, was relieved due to mental instability, and had clearances revoked in 1958, could compromise sensitive information about military intelligence operations and personnel suitability assessments. Also, the fact that Subject approached AMCONGEN Zurich could reveal intelligence interest in Subject. Quoting directly: 'SUBJECT SERVED JAPAN EARLY 1958 WITH 441ST CIC DETACHMENT. WAS RELIEVED CIC DUTIES IN APRIL 1958 DUE MENTAL INSTABILITY AND CLEARANCES REVOKED...PRESUME THIS REQUEST STEMS FROM HIS APPROACH AMCONGEN ZURICH JUNE 1968'.
summary: A cable from the CIA Director to the Bern station provides information about an individual (subject) who approached AMCONGEN Zurich in June 1968. The subject had previously served with the 441st CIC Detachment in Japan but was relieved of duties due to mental instability, and his clearances were revoked.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET cable, dated March 5, 1969, from the CIA Director to the Bern station, references previous communications and provides information on a subject who approached AMCONGEN Zurich in June 1968. The subject is described as a fabricator and mentally disturbed individual with no firm connections to the agency and no current LNHARP relationships. Previously unreported is the fact that the subject served in Japan with the 441st CIC Detachment in early 1958 but was relieved of CIC duties in April 1958 due to mental instability, resulting in the revocation of his clearances.
title: INK MHORDER WOMUSE
